intro: Mutisia camptosorifolia, commonly known as the mountain mutisia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly in regions of Argentina, Chile, and Bolivia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in mountainous areas and has a woody stem with alternate, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, dry fruits called achenes. Mutisia camptosorifolia is often found in shrublands and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
